official-title.#text:
To require the Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture to provide certain
			 Western States assistance in the development of statewide conservation and
			 management plans for the protection and recovery of sage grouse species,
			 and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Sage Grouse Protection and Conservation Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Sage Grouse Protection and Conservation Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Greater sage-grouse protection and conservation measures

text.#text: In this section:

term.#tail:
means each of the States of California, Colorado, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, North Dakota, Oregon,
			 South Dakota, Utah, Washington, and Wyoming.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means the Federal lands within the

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 11(a) of the
			 Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974/s:11/ss:a

term.#tail: has the meaning given that term in

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 103(e) of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of
			 1976
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:103/ss:e

term.#tail:
means the greater sage-grouse (Centrocercus urophasianus) and the Gunnison sage-grouse
			 (Centrocercus minimus).

text.#text: The term
The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , with respect to National Forest System lands; and

text.#text: the
the

quote.#tail:
means a statewide conservation and management plan for the protection and recovery of sage grouse
			 species within a covered western State.

text.#text: The term

header.#text: Secretarial participation in State planning process

text.#text:
Not later than 30 days after receipt of notice from a covered western State that the State is
			 initiating or has initiated development of a statewide conservation and
			 management plan for the protection and recovery of the sage grouse species
			 within the State, the Secretary shall provide to the Governor of that
			 covered western State—
a commitment of the Secretary’s willingness to participate in such development;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as
			 applicable, who shall represent the Secretary as a participant in such
			 development; and

text.#text: a list of designees from the

a list of other Federal departments that could be invited by the covered western State to
			 participate.

Not later than 60 days after receipt of such notice from the covered western State, the Secretary
			 shall provide to the State all relevant scientific data, research, or
			 information regarding sage grouse species and habitat within the State for
			 use by appropriate State personnel to assist the State in such
			 development.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
agencies, respectively, available, on at least a monthly
			 basis, to meet with officials of the State to develop or implement such a
			 plan.

text.#text: The Secretary shall make personnel from

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Sage Grouse Protection and Conservation Act/s:2/ss:b

text.#text: A notice under
be submitted by a Governor of any covered western State; and
include—
an invitation for the Secretary to participate in development of the statewide plan; and

a commitment that, not later than 2 years after the submission of a notice under this section, the
			 State shall present to the Secretary for review a 10-year (or longer) sage
			 grouse species conservation and management plan for the entire State.

If the Secretary receives such a statewide plan from a covered western State not later than 2 years
			 after receiving such notice from the State, the Secretary shall—

review the statewide plan using the best available science and data to determine if the statewide
			 plan is likely to—
conserve the sage grouse species to the point at which the measures provided pursuant to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
are no longer
			 necessary in the State; and

text.#text: conserve the habitat essential to conserve the sage grouse species within the State; and

approve or endorse, or make comments on, the statewide plan not later than 120 days after it is
			 submitted.

header.#text: Actions after statewide plan is submitted

text.#text:
Not later than 30 days after receipt of such a statewide conservation and management plan from a
			 covered western State, the Secretary shall—
take necessary steps to place on hold—
all actions with respect to listing any sage grouse species in that State under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, for a period of not less
			 than 10 years;

text.#text: enforcement of any current listing of sage grouse species within that State under such Act; and

designation of any critical habitat for any sage grouse species within that State under such Act;
			 and

withdraw any land use planning activities related to Federal management of sage grouse on Federal
			 lands within that State and take immediate steps to amend all Federal land
			 use plans to comply with such plan with respect to that State, if—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Sage Grouse Protection and Conservation Act/s:2/ss:b

text.#text:
the State presents to the Secretary its conservation and management plan not later than 2 years
			 after the State submits notice to the Secretary under
the State is implementing the plan.
Any proposed action pursuant to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that occurs within a covered western State may not be denied or
			 restricted solely on the basis of sage-grouse if such action is consistent
			 with a statewide plan that has been submitted by the State to the
			 Secretary.

text.#text: The Secretary shall—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, give effect to a statewide conservation and management plan
			 for the protection and recovery of sage grouse species within a covered
			 western State that is submitted by such State and approved or endorsed by
			 the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Sage Grouse Protection and Conservation Act/s:2/ss:f/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
before the date of the
			 enactment of this Act, in accordance with the terms of approval or
			 endorsement of the plan by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: United States Fish and Wildlife Services
United States Fish and Wildlife Services

text.#text: except as provided in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Sage Grouse Protection and Conservation Act/s:2/ss:b/p:3

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, treat such a plan as a plan referred to in each such
			 subsection.
